  • Destruction of the environment . For example, would the building of a new school involve the removal of a wooded area? How would the local wildlife be affected by the potential loss of a habitat?
    环境破坏。例如，建造一所新学校是否需要移除一片林地？栖息地的丧失会对当地野生动物造成怎样的影响？
  • Shifts in quality of education provided . What if the new school attracts skilled teachers or gifted students away from other schools? What if the new school absorbed a significant amount of the funds available to schools, depriving other schools of the same funds?
    教育质量的变化。如果新学校从其他学校吸引来优秀的教师或优秀学生怎么办？如果新学校占用了大量学校可用资金，导致其他学校无法获得同等资金怎么办？
  • Effects of property values . If the school does not do well in comparison with national standards, how will this affect the property values of the houses in the surrounding community?
    房产价值的影响。如果学校的成绩达不到国家标准，这将如何影响周边社区的房产价值？
  • Increased tax burden . How would the new school be funded? If the new school is a public school, the opening of the new school could result in an increase in property taxes for the local community to help support the new school.
    税收负担加重。新学校的资金来源是什么？如果新学校是公立学校，那么新学校的开办可能会导致当地社区的房产税增加，以支持新学校的运营。
  • Prevention of other potentially helpful expansion . Is it possible that the land used for the school would have better been used for some other new building? For example, what if there were plenty of schools, but not enough jobs in the neighborhood, would the land have been better used to build new businesses?
    阻碍其他潜在的有益发展。用于建造学校的土地是否可以更好地用于建造其他新建筑？例如，如果学校很多，但附近工作机会不足，那么这块土地是否更适合用于建设新的商业设施？
  • Increased demand for housing . Is there enough housing available in the community to accommodate new teachers and families that desire access to the new school?
    住房需求增加。社区内是否有足够的住房来容纳希望就读新学校的新教师和家庭？

Questions such as these can give us pause for thought before jumping on the bandwagon of a proposed action.

诸如此类的问题可以让我们在盲目跟风采取某项行动之前停下来思考一番。

Omitted Information That Remains Missing

遗漏的信息仍然缺失

Just because you are able to request important missing information does not guarantee a satisfactory response. It is quite possible that your probing questions cannot be answered. Do not despair! You did your part. You requested information that you needed to make up your mind; you must now decide whether it is possible to arrive at a conclusion without the missing information. We warned you earlier that reasoning is always incomplete. Therefore, to claim automatically that you cannot make a decision as long as information is missing would prevent you from ever forming any opinions.

仅仅因为你能够请求获取重要的缺失信息，并不能保证你会得到满意的答复。你的探究性问题很可能无法得到解答。别灰心！你已经尽力了。你请求获取了做出决定所需的信息；现在你必须决定，在缺少信息的情况下，是否有可能得出结论。我们之前就提醒过你，推理永远是不完整的。因此，如果你因为缺少信息就断言自己无法做出决定，那么你永远也无法形成任何观点。

USING THIS CRITICAL QUESTION

利用这个关键问题

Once you have thought about the existence of missing information in an argument, what should you do? The first logical reaction is to seek the information. But usually you will encounter resistance. Your options as a critical thinker are to voice your displeasure with the argument in light of the missing information, keep searching for the information that you require, or cautiously agree with the reasoning on the grounds that this argument is better than its competitors.

一旦你意识到某个论证中存在信息缺失，你应该怎么做？首先，你很自然地会去寻找这些信息。但通常你会遇到阻力。作为一名批判性思考者，你可以选择表达你对论证中信息缺失的不满，继续寻找你需要的信息，或者谨慎地认同这个论证，因为它比其他论证更有说服力。

Missing Information and Your Own Writing and Speaking

信息缺失以及您自身的写作和演讲

When you communicate, you will necessarily omit some information that your audience needs. However, at the same time, your experience using this critical question as an evaluative tool should forewarn you that some information is especially important for a strong argument. When you write or speak, you show respect for your audience when you include specific information that you know in advance will assist them in deciding the merits of your reasoning.

在沟通中，你不可避免地会省略一些听众需要的信息。然而，同时，你运用这个关键问题作为评估工具的经验应该会让你意识到，有些信息对于构建一个强有力的论点至关重要。当你写作或发言时，如果你事先知道某些信息有助于听众判断你论证的优劣，那么你就是在尊重他们。

For example, when you propose an action, think about potential, relevant counterarguments to what you are advocating and share those counterarguments with your audience. To do otherwise is to insult them. They know there are alternative perspectives. So, in the interest of your own integrity, be open about their existence.

例如，当你提出一项行动方案时，要思考可能存在的、相关的反驳论点，并将这些反驳论点分享给你的听众。否则，就是在侮辱他们。他们知道存在其他观点。所以，为了维护你自身的正直，请坦诚地承认这些反驳论点的存在。

Critical Question : What significant information is omitted?
关键问题：遗漏了哪些重要信息？

Practice Exercises

练习题

In each of the following examples, there is important missing information. Make a list of questions you would ask the person who wrote each passage. Explain in each case why the information you are seeking is important to you as you try to decide the worth of the reasoning.

以下每个例子都缺少重要的信息。请列出你想问每篇文章作者的问题。在判断文章论证的价值时，请解释你所寻求的信息对你为何如此重要。

Passage 1
第一段
Recent research has shown that eating and sleeping less can lead to a longer life. In laboratory experiments, rats fed a bare minimum and allowed to sleep much less than normal were found to be better able to recover from injuries and to live longer lives than rats that were fed plenty of food and slept a substantial amount. The researchers concluded that people, too, could benefit from less eating and sleeping and more physical activity.
近期研究表明，减少饮食和睡眠可以延长寿命。在实验室实验中，研究人员发现，与食物充足、睡眠充足的大鼠相比，那些被喂食极少量食物且睡眠时间远少于正常水平的大鼠，伤后恢复能力更强，寿命也更长。研究人员由此得出结论，人类也可以从减少饮食和睡眠、增加体育锻炼中获益。
Passage 2
第二段
Cloning technology can lead to many positive breakthroughs in the medical field. If we were to adequately develop cloning technology, there would no longer be a need for people to die because of a lack of organ donors. With cloning, researchers could artificially develop new organs for people in need of transplants. Plus, because these organs would be cloned from the person's own tissues, there would be no chance of their body rejecting the transplanted organ. The cloned organs can be made in bodies that lack a head, and thus would not involve a "death" in order to save a life. Another advantage of cloning is that it can help fight disease. Certain proteins produced by clones can be used to fight diseases such as diabetes, Parkinson's disease, and Cystic Fibrosis.
克隆技术有望在医学领域带来诸多积极的突破。如果我们能够充分发展克隆技术，就不会再有人因为缺乏器官捐献者而丧命。借助克隆技术，研究人员可以为需要移植的患者人工培育新的器官。此外，由于这些器官是由患者自身的组织克隆而成，因此不会出现排异反应。克隆器官甚至可以在没有头部的躯体中制造，从而避免了为了拯救生命而“牺牲”患者。克隆技术的另一个优势在于它可以帮助对抗疾病。克隆体产生的某些蛋白质可以用于治疗糖尿病、帕金森病和囊性纤维化等疾病。
Passage 3
第三段
America is the policeman of the world. It is our job to go into countries that need our help and to watch over them. One effective way to limit the interactions we need to have with other countries is to encourage the development of democracy and free markets in these countries. After all, the modern Western democracies have not fought wars against one another, and they are all democratic with a free market structure. Furthermore, look at the easy transition Germany had when it was reunited. Democracy was installed and the formerly split West and East Germany came along just fine. In fact, the German economy did really well with the transition also. Germany currently has the third largest GDP of any country in the world, all because of democracy and capitalism.
美国是世界警察。我们的职责是进入需要帮助的国家，并监督它们。限制我们与其他国家互动的一种有效方法是鼓励这些国家发展民主和自由市场。毕竟，现代西方民主国家之间从未发生过战争，而且它们都是民主国家，拥有自由市场经济结构。此外，看看德国统一时的顺利过渡就知道了。民主制度得以建立，曾经分裂的西德和东德也顺利融合。事实上，德国经济在转型过程中也表现出色。德国目前拥有世界第三大GDP，这一切都归功于民主和资本主义。

Sample Responses

示例回复

Passage 1
第一段
CONCLUSION: People would benefit from, eating and sleeping less.
结论：人们会从少吃少睡中受益。
REASON: Studies on rats have shown that when rats eat and sleep less, they recover from injuries better and live longer than other rats.
原因：对老鼠的研究表明，当老鼠吃得少、睡得少时，它们从伤病中恢复得更好，寿命也更长。

Before we all start to cut back on our food intake and amount of sleep, we should re-evaluate the information provided leading to this conclusion. What are the counterarguments, for example? Is it possible that humans and rats differ too much to generalize from one to other about the effects of sleep? Also, how much longer did the rats that ate and slept less live, and how much faster did these same rats recover from injuries? Is it possible that the variance is small or insignificant? Did the rats suffer any negative effects from eating and sleeping less? Would the rats have lived longer and recovered faster if instead of sleeping and eating less they ate and slept far more than the other rats?

在我们开始减少食物摄入量和睡眠时间之前，我们应该重新评估得出此结论的信息。例如，有哪些反驳论点？人类和老鼠的差异是否过大，以至于无法将睡眠的影响概括到两者之间？此外，那些吃得少睡得少的老鼠寿命究竟延长了多少？它们的伤后恢复速度又快了多少？这种差异是否可能很小或微不足道？老鼠是否因为吃得少睡得少而遭受任何负面影响？如果这些老鼠的进食和睡眠时间远超其他老鼠，它们的寿命是否会更长，恢复速度是否会更快？

Furthermore, just what do we know about the testing procedures? Nothing at all! These are just a few of the questions we would want to ask before we relied on the information in this passage.

此外，我们对测试程序究竟了解多少？一无所知！在依赖本文信息之前，我们应该先提出这些问题。

Passage 2
第二段
CONCLUSION: Cloning can provide positive medical benefits.
结论：克隆技术可以带来积极的医疗益处。
REASONS: 1. Clones can be used for human transplants.2. Clones can be used to help combat certain diseases.
原因：1.克隆可用于人体移植。2.克隆可用于帮助对抗某些疾病。

First, we should note that this reasoning advocates pursuing a new technology—human cloning—and cites only its advantages. The writer omits possible disadvantages. We need to consider both advantages and disadvantages. What serious side effects might result from using cloned organs? Are cloned organs as stable as regular organs? What positive and negative effects might cloning technology have on human decision-making? Would people be less likely to take care of their bodies and their organs if they knew that new organs could be grown to replace their current ones? Would the availability of the technology lead people to misuse cloning to produce complete human clones for an insidious purpose? Would people clone themselves, helping add to the burden already placed on the Earth by the current population? The advantages of the procedure may well outweigh the disadvantages, but we need to be aware of both in judging the merits of the conclusion.

首先，我们应该注意到，这种论证提倡发展一项新技术——人类克隆——并且只列举了它的优点。作者忽略了可能的缺点。我们需要同时考虑优点和缺点。使用克隆器官可能会产生哪些严重的副作用？克隆器官是否像天然器官一样稳定？克隆技术会对人类的决策产生哪些积极和消极的影响？如果人们知道可以培育新的器官来替换现有的器官，他们是否会更不愿意照顾自己的身体和器官？这项技术的普及是否会导致人们滥用克隆技术，制造出完全克隆的人类以达到某种不可告人的目的？人们是否会克隆自己，从而加重地球人口已经造成的负担？这项技术的优点或许远大于缺点，但在判断结论的合理性时，我们需要同时考虑到这两方面。

Furthermore, let's look at the missing information regarding the research. Did you notice that no research has been cited? In fact, the argument fails to tell us that no tests on human cloning have occurred in the United States. Therefore, all of the discussion on the benefits of cloning is hypothetical. Would actual research prove the hypothetical benefits to be possible? We do not know.

此外，我们来看看这项研究中缺失的信息。您是否注意到，文中并未引用任何研究？事实上，该论点甚至没有提及美国尚未进行过任何人类克隆试验。因此，所有关于克隆益处的讨论都只是假设。实际研究能否证实这些假设的益处？我们不得而知。

CRITICAL QUESTION SUMMARY: WHY THIS QUESTION IS IMPORTANT

关键问题总结：为什么这个问题很重要

What Significant Information Is Omitted?

遗漏了哪些重要信息？

When an author is trying to persuade you of something, she often leaves out important information. This information is often useful in assessing the worth of the conclusion. By explicitly looking for omitted information, you can determine whether the author has provided you with enough information to support the reasoning. If she has left out too much information, you cannot accept the reasons as support for the conclusion. Consequently, you should choose to reject her conclusion.

当作者试图说服你接受某种观点时，她常常会省略一些重要的信息。这些信息对于评估结论的价值至关重要。通过仔细查找被省略的信息，你可以判断作者是否提供了足够的信息来支持其论证。如果她省略了太多信息，你就无法接受这些理由作为结论的依据。因此，你应该选择拒绝她的结论。

#↩

CHAPTER 13 WHAT REASONABLE CONCLUSIONS ARE POSSIBLE?

第十三章 可能的合理结论有哪些？

By this stage you should be better equipped to pan for intellectual gold—to distinguish stronger reasons from weaker ones. Consider the following argument:

到了这个阶段，你应该更有能力去挖掘有价值的论点——区分更有力的论点和较弱的论点。请思考以下论证：

Large corporations spend far too much time and money advertising to children. Children's programming is riddled with commercials trying to sell them the latest toy, telling the children they will not be happy unless they have it. The practice of advertising to children is horrendous and should be illegal. Advertising to children, who cannot critically evaluate the ads they see, puts a strain on parents to either say "no" to their children and have them get upset, or to give in to their children's demands, ultimately spoiling the children.
大型企业花费大量时间和金钱进行儿童广告宣传。儿童节目中充斥着推销最新玩具的广告，仿佛在告诉孩子们，如果得不到玩具，他们就不会快乐。这种针对儿童的广告行为极其恶劣，应该被禁止。儿童无法批判性地评估广告内容，因此，针对儿童的广告给父母带来了巨大的压力：要么对孩子说“不”，结果孩子伤心；要么一味地满足孩子的要求，最终导致孩子被宠坏。

Should you urge your local congressman to criminalize advertisements to children? Suppose you checked the author's reasons and found them believable. Are there other conclusions that might be equally consistent with these reasons as the author's conclusion? The chapter summary will suggest several possible alternative conclusions.

你是否应该敦促你所在选区的国会议员将针对儿童的广告定为犯罪？假设你核实了作者的理由，并且认为这些理由可信。那么，是否存在其他与作者结论同样符合这些理由的结论呢？本章总结将提出几种可能的替代结论。

Very rarely will you have a situation in which only one conclusion can be reasonably inferred. In an earlier chapter, we discussed the importance of rival causes. The point there was that there are different possible causal bases for a particular conclusion. This chapter, however, focuses on the alternative conclusions that are all possible outcomes from a single set of reasons.

极少情况下，你只能合理推断出一个结论。在前一章中，我们讨论了相互竞争的原因的重要性。当时的重点是，一个特定的结论可能存在不同的因果基础。然而，本章将重点讨论由同一组原因得出的所有可能结论。

Consequently, you must make sure that the conclusion you eventually adopt is the most reasonable and the most consistent with your value preferences. The recognition that the reasons could provide support for conclusions different from yours should heighten your interest in any further tests or studies that would help identify the best conclusion.

因此，您必须确保最终采纳的结论是最合理的，并且最符合您的价值观。认识到这些理由可能支持与您不同的结论，应该会增强您对任何有助于确定最佳结论的进一步测试或研究的兴趣。

Critical Question : What reasonable conclusions are possible?
关键问题：可以得出哪些合理的结论？

Assumptions and Multiple Conclusions

假设与多重结论

Evidence attempting to support a factual claim or a group of strong reasons supporting a prescriptive conclusion can both be interpreted to mean different things. Reasons do not generally speak for themselves in an obvious way. As we have seen many times, conclusions are reached only after someone makes certain interpretations or assumptions concerning the meaning of the reasons.

支持事实主张的证据和支持规范性结论的一系列有力理由，都可以被解读为不同的含义。理由本身通常并不显而易见。正如我们多次看到的，只有在对理由的含义做出某些解读或假设之后，才能得出结论。

If you make a different assumption concerning the meaning of the reasons, you will reach different conclusions. Because we all possess different levels of perceptual precision, frames of reference, and prior knowledge, we repeatedly disagree about which assumptions are preferable. We form different conclusions from reasons because our diverse backgrounds and goals cause us to be attracted to different assumptions when we decide to link reasons to conclusions.

如果你对理由的含义做出不同的假设，你就会得出不同的结论。因为我们每个人的感知精确度、参照框架和先验知识水平都不同，所以我们对于哪些假设更可取往往意见不一。我们之所以会从理由中得出不同的结论，是因为我们不同的背景和目标导致我们在将理由与结论联系起来时倾向于不同的假设。

Sometimes a writer or speaker will mention alternative conclusions that can be reached on the basis of the reasons he has presented. However, you will often have to generate possible alternatives. To perform this creative task, try to imagine what different assumptions might enable someone to jump from the reasons you have identified to another conclusion. Remember, many possible conclusions can be made on the basis of most sets of reasons. The next two sections will help you recognize the multiplicity of possible conclusions.

有时，作者或演讲者会提及基于其提出的理由可能得出的其他结论。然而，你往往需要自己提出可能的替代方案。为了完成这项创造性的任务，试着想象哪些不同的假设可能使人们从你列举的理由推导出另一个结论。记住，大多数理由组合都可能得出多种结论。接下来的两节将帮助你认识到结论的多样性。

Dichotomous Thinking: Impediment to Considering Multiple Conclusions

二元思维：阻碍考虑多种结论

Very few important questions can be answered with a simple "yes" or an absolute "no." When people think in black or white, yes or no, right or wrong, or correct or incorrect terms, they engage in dichotomous thinking. This type of thinking consists of assuming there are only two possible answers to a question that has multiple potential answers. This habit of seeing and referring to both sides of a question as if there are only two has devastatingly destructive effects on our thinking. By restricting the conclusions we consider to be only two, we are sharply reducing the robust possibilities that careful reasoning can produce.

很少有重要问题能用简单的“是”或绝对的“否”来回答。当人们用非黑即白、非此即彼、非对即错、非对即错的思维方式思考时，他们就陷入了二元思维。这种思维方式假定一个问题只有两种可能的答案，而实际上这个问题可能有多种答案。这种将问题的正反两面都视为只有两种选择的习惯，会对我们的思维造成毁灭性的破坏。通过将我们认为的结论限制在两种，我们大大减少了严谨推理所能产生的各种可能性。

We encountered dichotomous thinking earlier when we discussed the Either-or fallacy. This fallacy, and dichotomous thinking in general, damages reasoning by overly restricting our vision. We think we are finished after considering two optional decisions, thereby overlooking many options and the positive consequences that could have resulted from choosing one of them.

我们在之前讨论“非此即彼谬误”时就接触过二元思维。这种谬误，以及一般的二元思维，会过度限制我们的视野，从而损害推理能力。我们往往认为考虑完两个选项就万事大吉了，却忽略了许多其他选择以及选择其中一个选项可能带来的积极后果。

Dichotomous thinkers often are rigid and intolerant because they fail to understand the importance of context for a particular answer. To see this point more clearly, imagine this situation:

二元思维者往往固执己见、缺乏包容心，因为他们未能理解特定答案所依据的背景信息。为了更清楚地说明这一点，请想象一下以下情境：

Your roommate asks you to help plan her biology paper. The paper is to address the question: Should scientists pursue stem cell research? In her mind, the paper requires her to defend a "yes" or "no" position.

你的室友请你帮忙规划她的生物学论文。论文的主题是：科学家是否应该进行干细胞研究？在她看来，这篇论文需要她论证一个“是”或“否”的立场。

You have learned that dichotomous thinking can be avoided by qualifying conclusions, by putting them into context. This qualification process requires you to ask about any conclusion:

你已经了解到，通过限定结论并将其置于特定语境中，可以避免二元思维。这种限定过程要求你对任何结论提出疑问：

  1. When is it accurate?
    什么时候才准确？
  2. Where is it accurate?
    它的准确性体现在哪里？
  3. Why or for what purpose is it accurate?
    它为何准确？或者说，它出于什么目的而准确？

You then begin to apply this process to the paper assignment.

然后，你开始将这个过程应用到论文写作中。

Would you be surprised by your roommate's growing frustration as you explained that at certain specified times, in certain situations, to maximize particular values or objectives one should allow stem cell research? She's looking for "yes" or "no"; you provided a complicated "it depends on. . ."

当你向室友解释说，在某些特定时间、某些情况下，为了最大限度地实现某些价值或目标，应该允许干细胞研究时，你会不会对她日益增长的沮丧感到惊讶？她想要的是一个“是”或“否”的答案；而你却给出了一个复杂的“这取决于……”。

Rigid, dichotomous thinking limits the range of your decisions and opinions. Even worse, it overly simplifies complex situations. As a consequence, dichotomous thinkers are high-risk candidates for confusion.

僵化的二元思维会限制你的决策和观点范围。更糟糕的是，它还会过度简化复杂的情况。因此，持有二元思维的人更容易感到困惑。

The next section illustrates the restrictive effects of dichotomous thinking.

下一节将阐述二元思维的局限性影响。

Two Sides or Many?

两方还是多方？

Before we look at several arguments in which multiple conclusions are possible, let's make sure you appreciate the large number of conclusions that are possible with respect to most important controversies. Here are three contemporary questions.

在探讨几个可能得出多种结论的论证之前，我们先来确保您了解，在大多数重要争议中，都存在大量可能的结论。以下是三个当代问题。

  1. Should the United States engage in peacekeeping in other countries?
    美国是否应该参与其他国家的维和行动？
  2. Is William Shakespeare the best playwright of all time?
    威廉·莎士比亚是有史以来最伟大的剧作家吗？
  3. Should scientists be held responsible for how their inventions are used?
    科学家是否应该对其发明的使用方式负责？

At first glance, these questions and many like them seem to call for yes or no answers. However, a qualified yes or no is often the best answer. The advantage of maybe as an answer is that it forces you to admit that you do not yet know enough to make a definite answer. But at the same time you avoid a definite answer; you form a tentative decision or opinion that calls for commitment and eventual action. It's wise to seek additional information that would improve the support for your opinions, but at some point you must stop searching and make a decision, even when the most forceful answer you are willing to defend is a "yes, but..."

乍一看，这些问题以及许多类似的问题似乎只需要回答“是”或“否”。然而，一个有条件的“是”或“否”往往才是最佳答案。“也许”作为答案的优势在于，它迫使你承认自己掌握的信息不足以做出明确的回答。但与此同时，你也避免了给出确切的答案；你形成了一个需要投入和最终行动的初步决定或观点。寻求更多信息来增强你的观点固然明智，但有时你必须停止寻找并做出决定，即使你最有力的答案是“是的，但是……”

Glance back at the three questions that preceded the last paragraph. Ask yourself what conclusions would be possible in response to each question. Naturally, a simple "yes" or a "no" answer would be two possible conclusions. Are there others? Yes, there are many! Let's look at just a few of the possible answers to the first of these questions.

回顾一下上一段之前的三个问题。问问自己，针对每个问题，可能得出哪些结论。当然，简单的“是”或“否”就是两种可能的结论。还有其他的吗？当然有很多！让我们来看看第一个问题的几种可能答案。

Should the United States Engage in Peacekeeping in Other Countries?

美国是否应该参与其他国家的维和行动？

  1. Yes, when the country is intricately tied to the United States, such as Saudi Arabia.
    是的，当一个国家与美国有着千丝万缕的联系时，例如沙特阿拉伯。
  2. Yes, if the United States is to be perceived as the sole superpower responsible for maintaining world peace.
    是的，如果美国被视为维护世界和平的唯一超级大国的话。
  3. Yes, if the United States' role is to be limited to keeping peace and does not involve actually fighting a war.
    是的，如果美国的角色仅限于维护和平，而不涉及实际发动战争的话。
  4. Yes, when our economic interests abroad are at stake.
    是的，当涉及到我们在海外的经济利益时。
  5. Yes, when Americans might be harmed by violence in other countries.
    是的，当美国人可能因其他国家的暴力事件而受到伤害时。
  6. No, the United States has enough domestic problems to handle such that we should not spend time in other countries.
    不，美国国内问题已经够多了，我们不应该把时间浪费在其他国家。
  7. No, if peacekeeping is the goal, such actions are better left up to the U.N. or NATO.
    不，如果维和是目标，这类行动最好留给联合国或北约来做。

Notice that in each case we added a condition necessary before the conclusion can be justified. In the absence of any data or definitions, any of these seven conclusions could be most reasonable. These seven are just a few of the conclusions possible for the first question.

请注意，在每种情况下，我们都添加了一个前提条件，只有满足这些条件，结论才能成立。在没有任何数据或定义的情况下，这七个结论中的任何一个都可能是最合理的。这七个结论只是针对第一个问题可能得出的众多结论中的一部分。

Just for practice, try to suggest five possible conclusions for the third question: Should scientists be held responsible for how their inventions are used?

为了练习，请尝试为第三个问题提出五个可能的结论：科学家是否应该对其发明的使用方式负责？

Perhaps this conclusion occurred to you: Yes, if it can be demonstrated that the scientist had reason to suspect that the invention would be used in a way other than intended, to the detriment of other people. Or, maybe you thought of this one: No, if the purpose of science is understood to be the betterment of humankind, scientific research is then aimed at helping people, and it is not the fault of scientists if potentially beneficial inventions are misused by others. But probably neither of these appears on your list. Why are we so sure? Because there are an enormous number of possible conclusions for this question! It should be an unlikely coincidence if you had chosen either of these two from the huge list of possible conclusions. This greater number of answers is what we want you to grasp. Knowledge of the possibility of multiple conclusions will prevent you from leaping to one prematurely.

或许你会想到这样的结论：是的，如果能够证明科学家有理由怀疑这项发明会被用于非预期用途，从而损害他人利益。或者，你可能想到的是：不，如果科学的目的是造福人类，那么科学研究的目标就是帮助人类，如果潜在的有益发明被他人滥用，科学家就没有过错。但很可能你并没有想到这两种结论。我们为什么如此肯定？因为这个问题可能有无数种可能的结论！如果你恰好从众多可能的结论中选择了这两种，那绝非巧合。我们希望你理解的是，答案的数量如此之多。了解存在多种结论的可能性，可以避免你过早地得出某个结论。

Searching for Multiple Conclusions

寻找多个结论

This section contains two arguments pointing out multiple conclusions that could be created from the reasons in each argument. The intention is to give you some models to use when you search for conclusions. In each case, we will give you the structure of the argument before we suggest alternative conclusions. Study the reasons without looking at the conclusion, and try to identify as many conclusions as possible that would follow from the reasons. You can always use the when, where, and why questions to help generate alternative conclusions.

本节包含两个论证，每个论证都指出了可以从其理由推导出的多个结论。目的是为您提供一些寻找结论的范例。在提出其他结论之前，我们会先展示论证的结构。请先仔细研究论证的理由，不要直接查看结论，并尝试找出尽可能多的可推导出的结论。您可以随时使用“何时”、“何地”和“为什么”等问题来帮助生成其他结论。

CONCLUSION: The United States should continue to use the death penalty as a form of punishment.
结论：美国应该继续使用死刑作为一种惩罚手段。
Reasons: 1. Without the death penalty, there is no way to punish people who commit wrongs, such as harming guards or inmates, after already having a life sentence. 2. It is only fair that someone should die for purposely taking the life of another.
理由：1. 如果没有死刑，就无法惩罚那些在被判终身监禁后仍然犯下罪行（例如伤害狱警或囚犯）的人。2. 故意夺取他人生命的人理应被处死。

Let's start by accepting these reasons as sensible to us. What do we then make of them? We have one answer in the conclusion of the writer: Continue the use of the death penalty.

我们先假设这些理由在我们看来是合理的。那么，我们该如何看待它们呢？答案就在作者的结论中：继续使用死刑。

But even when we accept these two reasons, we would not necessarily conclude the same thing. Other conclusions make at least as much sense on the basis of this support. For example, it would follow that we should continue to use the death penalty, but only in cases where someone has already been sentenced to life in prison, and the prisoner kills a guard or another inmate.

但即便我们接受这两个理由，也未必会得出相同的结论。基于这些论据，其他结论至少同样合理。例如，由此可以得出结论：我们应该继续使用死刑，但仅限于已被判处终身监禁的囚犯杀害狱警或其他囚犯的情况。

Alternatively, these reasons might suggest that we need to maintain the death penalty in cases of prisoners' harming guards or other prisoners. Not only is this alternative conclusion logically supported by the reasons, but it also leads to a conclusion quite different from the original conclusion.

或者，这些理由也可能表明，在囚犯伤害狱警或其他囚犯的情况下，我们需要维持死刑。这一替代结论不仅在逻辑上得到了论证的支持，而且也与最初的结论截然不同。

CONCLUSION: States need to allow people to end their lives when they feel their time has come.
结论：各国应该允许人们在认为自己生命已到尽头时结束自己的生命。
REASONS: 1. People have the right to choose when and how they want to die. 2. It is wrong to force people to stay alive, especially if they are suffering. 3. If ending one's life were legal, the government could regulate it more closely, allowing doctors to supervise suicides and administer pills to make the act quick and painless.
理由：1. 人们有权选择何时以及如何结束自己的生命。2. 强迫他人活下去是错误的，尤其是在他们遭受痛苦的情况下。3. 如果结束生命合法化，政府就可以对其进行更严格的监管，允许医生监督自杀过程，并提供药物使之快速且无痛苦。

What conclusions are possible? One would be to decriminalize suicide in one location and observe the ways in which the law is used and to what extent people avail themselves of the opportunity. Alternatively, the government could restrict the legalized suicides to cases where people are terminally ill and suffering. Another possibility based on a strong devotion to collective responsibility would be to allow the suicides, but only after the person went through a thorough counseling program to see if there was any way besides death that the person could find happiness. Observe that all three of these conclusions are possible even if we accept the truth of the three reasons. Thus, the same reasons frequently can be used to support several different conclusions.

可能的结论有哪些？一种可能是在一个地方将自杀合法化，观察法律的运用方式以及人们利用这一机会的程度。另一种可能是，政府将合法自杀限制在身患绝症且饱受痛苦的情况下。还有一种可能性，基于对集体责任的强烈认同，允许自杀，但前提是当事人必须接受全面的心理咨询，以确定除了死亡之外是否还有其他途径可以获得幸福。值得注意的是，即使我们接受这三个理由的真实性，所有这三个结论都是可能的。因此，相同的理由往往可以用来支持几种不同的结论。

Productivity of If-Clauses

If 语句的生产力

If you went back over all the alternative conclusions discussed in this chapter, you would notice that each optional conclusion is possible because we are missing certain information, definitions, assumptions, or the frame of reference of the person analyzing the reasons. Consequently, we can create multiple conclusions by the judicious use of if-clauses. In an if-clause, we state a condition that we are assuming in order to enable us to reach a particular conclusion. Notice that the use of if-clauses permits us to arrive at a conclusion without pretending that we know more than we actually do about a particular controversy.

如果你回顾一下本章讨论的所有备选结论，你会发现每个可能的结论都是因为我们缺少某些信息、定义、假设，或者分析理由的人的参照框架。因此，我们可以通过巧妙地使用条件从句来得出多个结论。在条件从句中，我们陈述一个假设条件，以便得出特定的结论。请注意，使用条件从句使我们能够得出结论，而无需假装我们对某个争议了解得比实际更多。

When you use if-clauses to precede conclusions, you are pointing out that your conclusion is based on particular claims or assumptions about which you are uncertain. To see what we mean, look at the following sample conditional statements that might precede conclusions.

当你在结论前使用条件从句时，你是在指出你的结论是基于你并不确定的特定主张或假设。为了更好地理解这一点，请看以下可能出现在结论前的条件语句示例。

  1. If the tax cut is targeted towards those at the lower end of the economic spectrum, then . . .
    如果减税政策的目标是经济地位较低的人群，那么……
  2. If a novel contains an easily identifiable protagonist, a clear antagonist, and a thrilling climax, then . . .
    如果一部小说包含一个容易辨认的主人公、一个明确的反派和一个激动人心的结局，那么……
  3. If automakers can make cars that are more fuel efficient, then . . .
    如果汽车制造商能够制造出更节能的汽车，那么……

If-clauses present you with multiple conclusions that you should assess before making up your mind about the controversy, and they also broaden the list of possible conclusions from which you can choose your own position.

如果从句会向你提供多个结论，你应该在对争议做出决定之前对这些结论进行评估；它们还会扩大可能的结论范围，你可以从中选择自己的立场。

Alternative Solutions as Conclusions

作为结论的替代方案

We frequently encounter issues posed in the following form:

我们经常遇到以下形式的问题：

Such questions naturally "pull" for dichotomous thinking. Often, however, posing questions in this manner hides a broader question, "What should we do about Y?" (usually some pressing problem). Rewording the question in this way leads us to generate multiple conclusions of a particular form: solutions to the problem raised by the reasons. Generating multiple solutions greatly increases the flexibility of our thinking.

这类问题自然而然地会“诱导”我们进行二元思维。然而，以这种方式提出问题往往隐藏着一个更广泛的问题：“我们应该如何处理Y问题？”（通常是一些紧迫的问题）。以这种方式重新表述问题，可以引导我们得出多种特定形式的结论：即针对上述理由所提出的问题的解决方案。产生多种解决方案能够极大地增强我们思维的灵活性。

Let's examine the following passage to illustrate the importance of generating multiple solutions as possible conclusions.

让我们来看下面的段落，以说明提出多种解决方案作为可能结论的重要性。

Should we close the bars downtown? The answer is a resounding yes! Since the bars opened, a dozen young college students have suffered from alcohol poisoning.
我们应该关闭市中心的酒吧吗？答案是肯定的！自从这些酒吧开业以来，已有十几名年轻的大学生酒精中毒。

Once we change this question to, "What should we do about the number of college students suffering from alcohol poisoning?" a number of possible solutions come to mind, which help us formulate our conclusion to the issue. For example, we might conclude: "No, we should not close the bars downtown; rather, we should strictly enforce the drinking age and fine bars that sell alcoholic beverages to minors."

一旦我们将问题改为“我们应该如何应对大学生酒精中毒问题？”，许多可能的解决方案就会浮现在脑海中，帮助我们形成对该问题的结论。例如，我们可能会得出这样的结论：“不，我们不应该关闭市中心的酒吧；相反，我们应该严格执行饮酒年龄限制，并对向未成年人出售酒精饮料的酒吧处以罚款。”

When reasons in a prescriptive argument are statements of practical problems, look for different solutions to the problems as possible conclusions.

当规范性论证中的理由是对实际问题的陈述时，要寻找针对这些问题的不同解决方案作为可能的结论。

Clues for Identifying Alternative Conclusions

识别其他结论的线索

  1. Try to identify as many conclusions as possible that would follow from the reasons.
    试着从这些理由中找出尽可能多的结论。
  2. Use if-clauses to qualify alternative conclusions.
    使用条件语句来限定其他可能的结论。
  3. Reword the issue to "What should we do about Y?"
    将问题重新表述为“我们应该如何处理Y问题？”

The Liberating Effect of Recognizing Alternative Conclusions

认识到其他结论所带来的解放作用

If logic, facts, or studies were self-explanatory, we would approach learning in a particular manner. Our task would be to have someone else, a teacher perhaps, provide the beliefs that we should have. Specifically, we would seek that single identifiable set of beliefs that logic and facts dictate.

如果逻辑、事实或研究本身就能解释一切，那么我们的学习方式就会有所不同。我们会依赖他人，比如老师，来提供我们应该持有的信念。具体来说，我们会寻求那套由逻辑和事实所决定的、单一且明确的信念体系。

While we have tremendous respect for logic and facts, we cannot exaggerate their worth as guides for conclusion formation. They take us only so far; then we have to go the rest of the way toward belief, using the help that facts and logic have provided.

我们固然非常尊重逻辑和事实，但也不能过分夸大它们作为得出结论指南的价值。它们只能带我们走到一定程度；接下来，我们还需要借助事实和逻辑提供的帮助，继续探索，最终形成信念。

A first step in using that help is the search for possible multiple conclusions consistent with logic and the facts as we know them. This search liberates us in an important way. It frees us from the inflexible mode of learning sketched above. Once we recognize the variety of possible conclusions, each of us can experience the excitement of enhanced personal choice.

利用这种帮助的第一步是寻找符合逻辑和我们已知事实的多种可能结论。这种寻找以一种重要的方式解放了我们。它使我们摆脱了上述僵化的学习模式。一旦我们认识到各种可能的结论，我们每个人都能体验到自主选择带来的乐趣。

All Conclusions Are Not Created Equal

并非所有结论都具有相同的价值。

We want to warn you that the rewarding feeling that often comes with generating multiple conclusions may tempt you to treat them as equally credible and to believe your job is done after you've made your list. But remember that some conclusions can be better justified than others, and the most believable ones should be the ones that most affect your reaction to the author's reasoning. Indeed, one clever way to weaken strong reasoning about global warming or the cause of the war in Iraq or the wisdom of distance learning is to make the claim that experts disagree.

我们想提醒您，得出多个结论带来的成就感可能会让您误以为所有结论都同样可信，并在列出清单后就认为任务完成了。但请记住，有些结论比其他结论更有说服力，而最能打动您对作者论证的感受的结论，才是最令人信服的。事实上，削弱关于全球变暖、伊拉克战争起因或远程教育的合理性等有力论证的一个巧妙方法，就是声称专家们意见不一。

The implication of such a statement is that once disagreement is identified, one argument is as good as the next. Therefore, there is no basis for new action to address the problem. But such an approach is insulting to careful critical thinking. Critical thinkers have standards of careful reasoning that they can apply to identify the strongest reasoning.

这种说法暗示，一旦发现分歧，所有论点都一样好。因此，也就没有理由采取新的行动来解决问题。但这种观点是对严谨批判性思维的侮辱。批判性思考者拥有严谨的推理标准，并能运用这些标准来识别最有力的论证。

Summary

概括

Very rarely do reasons mean just one thing. After evaluating a set of reasons, you still must decide what conclusion is most consistent with the best reasons in the controversy. To avoid dichotomous thinking in your search for the strongest conclusion, provide alternative contexts for the conclusions through the use of when, where, and why questions.

理由很少只代表一种含义。在评估了一系列理由之后，你仍然需要决定哪个结论与争议中最有力的理由最为一致。为了避免在寻找最有力结论的过程中陷入二元思维，可以通过提出“何时”、“何地”和“为什么”等问题，为结论提供不同的背景。

Qualifications for conclusions will move you away from dichotomous thinking. If-clauses provide a technique for expressing these qualifications.

对结论进行限定能帮助你摆脱二元思维。条件从句提供了一种表达这些限定条件的方法。

For instance, let's take another look at the argument for restricting advertisements aimed at children at the beginning of the chapter. What alternative conclusions might be consistent with the reasons given?

例如，让我们再来看看本章开头提出的限制针对儿童的广告的论点。除了这些论点之外，还有哪些结论可能与给出的理由相符？

AUTHOR'S CONCLUSION: Advertisements aimed at children should be illegal
作者结论：针对儿童的广告应该被禁止。
ALTERNATIVE CONCLUSIONS: 1. If corporations are to be treated as persons, then they have a right to free speech that includes advertisements; thus, their right to advertise should not be limited. 2. If it can be demonstrated that children are unable to assess what they view, and thus are heavily influenced by the advertisements they see, then advertisements aimed at children should be illegal. 3. If the purpose of the proposed legislation is to limit the content of advertisements aimed at children, then the government should not make such ads illegal, but rather take a more proactive role in regulating the content of advertisements aimed at children.
其他结论：1. 如果将公司视为法人，那么它们享有言论自由，包括广告自由；因此，它们的广告权不应受到限制。2. 如果能够证明儿童无法评估他们所看到的内容，因此极易受到广告的影响，那么针对儿童的广告就应该被禁止。3. 如果拟议立法的目的是限制针对儿童的广告内容，那么政府不应直接禁止此类广告，而应在监管针对儿童的广告内容方面发挥更积极的作用。

Many additional alternative conclusions are possible in light of the author's reasons. We would shrink the quality of our decision making if we did not consider those alternative conclusions as possible bases for our own beliefs.

根据作者的论证，还有许多其他可能的结论。如果我们不将这些可能的结论作为我们自身信念的依据，我们的决策质量就会降低。

Practice Exercises

练习题

Critical Question: What reasonable conclusions are possible?

关键问题：可以得出哪些合理的结论？

For each of the following arguments, identify different conclusions that could be drawn from the reasons.

针对下列每个论点，找出可以从其理由中得出的不同结论。

Passage 1
第一段
Feeding large numbers of people is not easy. However, dining halls on campus should try to accommodate a larger variety of tastes. Students all across campus consistently complain not only about the quality of food, but the lack of selection they find in the dining halls. All the dining halls need to do is offer a wider range of food to better please more students, and thus keep more of them eating on campus as opposed to off campus. Dining services is failing its duty to the students when it does not provide a large selection of food options every day.
为大量学生提供膳食并非易事。然而，校园食堂应该努力满足更多不同的口味。全校学生经常抱怨食堂的食物质量差，而且选择太少。食堂只需提供更丰富的菜品，就能更好地满足更多学生的需求，从而吸引更多学生在校内用餐，而不是在校外用餐。如果餐饮服务不能每天提供丰富的食物选择，那就是对学生失职。
Passage 2
第二段
I have never been that strong of a runner, but when I bought my new training shoes, Mercury, my time greatly improved. Now I can run faster, longer, and am less sore afterward. Runner's Digest also says the Mercury is one of the best shoes on the market. Therefore, all people who want to run should buy Mercury shoes.
我以前跑步水平并不高，但自从买了新的训练鞋 Mercury 之后，我的成绩有了显著提高。现在我可以跑得更快、更远，而且跑后也不那么酸痛了。《跑者文摘》也说 Mercury 是市面上最好的跑鞋之一。因此，所有想跑步的人都应该买一双 Mercury 跑鞋。
Passage 3
第三段
Many people feel it is a good idea to legalize prostitution. A substantial number of people visit prostitutes now even though the practice is generally illegal. So proponents argue that it makes sense to legalize prostitution. Are these people right? Absolutely not! Prostitution is a horribly immoral practice and it should not be legalized. Prostitution helps spread sexually transmitted infections. Also, the legalization of prostitution will cause more men to cheat on their wives with prostitutes with the consequent negative fallout for families. Nothing good could possibly come from the legalization of prostitution.
许多人认为卖淫合法化是个好主意。尽管卖淫通常是非法的，但仍有相当多的人光顾妓院。因此，支持者认为卖淫合法化是合理的。这些人是对的吗？绝对不是！卖淫是一种极其不道德的行为，不应该合法化。卖淫会助长性传播疾病的蔓延。此外，卖淫合法化会导致更多男性背着妻子嫖娼，从而给家庭带来负面影响。卖淫合法化绝不会有任何好处。

Sample Responses

示例回复

Passage 1
第一段
CONCLUSION: Dining services are not doing an adequate job of providing food on campus.
结论：校园餐饮服务在提供食物方面做得不够好。
REASONS: 1. Students are upset about the quality of the food. 2. There are not enough options provided every day. 3. More options would keep students happy and keep them eating on campus.
原因：1. 学生对食物质量不满。2. 每天提供的食物种类不够丰富。3. 增加食物种类能让学生满意，并促使他们继续在校园内用餐。

To work on this particular critical-thinking skill, we need to assume that the reasons are strong ones. If we accept these reasons as reliable, we could also reasonably infer the following conclusions:

要培养这种批判性思维能力，我们需要假设这些理由是充分的。如果我们认为这些理由可靠，我们也可以合理地推断出以下结论：

If dining services' goal is to provide a wide selection of food while ensuring the least amount of wasted food at the end of the day, then they are not letting students down with the current selections offered to students.
如果餐饮服务的目标是在提供多种食物选择的同时，尽可能减少一天结束时的食物浪费，那么他们目前为学生提供的选择并没有让学生失望。
If dining services aim to keep the price of on-campus food down, and a more expansive menu would cause an increase in prices, they are not failing in their duty to students.
如果餐饮服务部门的目标是降低校园内食物的价格，而更丰富的菜单会导致价格上涨，那么他们并没有辜负学生的期望。

Notice that the alternative conclusions put dining services in quite a different light compared to the negative portrayal they received in the original conclusion.

请注意，其他结论对餐饮服务的描述与最初结论中的负面描述截然不同。

Passage 2
第二段
CONCLUSION: All potential runners should buy Mercury brand shoes.
结论：所有潜在的跑步者都应该购买Mercury品牌的跑鞋。
REASON: 1. When the author bought Mercury brand shoes, her time greatly improved. 2. Runner's Digest stated that Mercury brand shoes are some of the best running shoes on the market.
原因：1. 作者购买了Mercury品牌的跑鞋后，跑步成绩显著提高。2. 《跑者文摘》杂志指出，Mercury品牌的跑鞋是市面上最好的跑鞋之一。

On the basis of these reasons, we could infer several alternative conclusions:

基于以上原因，我们可以推断出以下几种结论：

Runners who are similar to the author should buy Mercury brand running shoes.
与作者体型相似的跑步者应该购买 Mercury 品牌的跑鞋。
If one can afford Mercury brand shoes, the shoes are a great resource for people who are trying to run faster and longer.
如果经济条件允许，Mercury品牌的跑鞋对于那些想要跑得更快更远的人来说是一个很好的选择。
If a runner is unhappy with the shoes she currently uses for training, then she should buy Mercury brand running shoes.
如果一名跑步运动员对她目前训练所用的鞋子不满意，那么她应该购买 Mercury 品牌的跑鞋。

CRITICAL QUESTION SUMMARY: WHY THIS QUESTION IS IMPORTANT

关键问题总结：为什么这个问题很重要

What Reasonable Conclusions Are Possible?

有哪些合理的结论是可能的？

When you are deciding whether to accept or reject an author's conclusion, you want to make sure that the author has come to the most reasonable conclusion. An author often oversteps his reasoning when he comes to a conclusion. By identifying alternative reasonable conclusions, you can determine which alternative conclusions, if any, you would be willing to accept in place of the author's conclusion. This step is the final tool in deciding whether to accept or reject the author's conclusion.

在决定是否接受作者的结论时，你需要确保作者得出的是最合理的结论。作者在得出结论时常常会过度推理。通过识别其他合理的结论，你可以确定是否愿意接受这些替代结论来取代作者的结论。这一步骤是决定是否接受作者结论的最终手段。

#↩

CHAPTER 14 PRACTICE AND REVIEW

第十四章 练习与复习

In this chapter, we put it all together. We begin by again listing the critical questions. This checklist should serve as a handy guide for you until the questions become second nature. When you encounter articles, lectures, debates, textbooks, commercials, Internet messages, or any other materials relating to an important issue, you will find it useful to go through the checklist and check off each question as you ask and answer it.

本章我们将所有内容整合起来。首先，我们再次列出关键问题。这份清单将作为您的实用指南，帮助您熟练掌握并运用这些问题。当您遇到与重要议题相关的文章、讲座、辩论、教科书、广告、网络信息或其他任何材料时，您会发现对照清单逐一核对问题非常有用，这样您就能提出并回答相应的问题。

Next we apply the critical questions by critically evaluating one position on a particular controversy. The major purpose of this discussion is to provide an example of a coherent application of all the critical-thinking steps.

接下来，我们将运用批判性问题，对某一特定争议中的立场进行批判性评估。本次讨论的主要目的是提供一个如何系统地运用所有批判性思维步骤的范例。

We suggest that you follow the discussion with several goals in mind. You can treat it as a check on your understanding of previous chapters. Would you have asked the same questions? Would you have formed similar answers? Do you feel better able to judge the worth of someone's reasoning?

我们建议您带着几个目标参与讨论。您可以将其视为对前几章内容理解的一次检验。您会提出同样的问题吗？您会得出类似的答案吗？您是否觉得自己更有能力判断他人论证的价值了？

Question Checklist for Critical Thinking

批判性思维问题清单

  1. What are the issue and the conclusion?
    问题是什么？结论是什么？
  2. What are the reasons?
    原因是什么？
  3. Which words or phrases are ambiguous?
    哪些词语或短语含义含糊不清？
  4. What are the value conflicts and assumptions?
    存在哪些价值冲突和假设？
  5. What are the descriptive assumptions?
    描述性假设是什么？
  6. Are there any fallacies in the reasoning?
    这种推理是否存在谬误？
  7. How good is the evidence?
    证据有多充分？
  8. Are there rival causes?
    是否存在相互竞争的事业？
  9. Are the statistics deceptive?
    统计数据是否具有欺骗性？
  10. What significant information is omitted?
    遗漏了哪些重要信息？
  11. What reasonable conclusions are possible?
    有哪些合理的结论是可能的？

Asking the Right Questions: A Comprehensive Example

提出正确的问题：一个全面的示例

We first present a passage that summarizes one position with respect to whether states should impose taxes to ensure that individuals maintain good health. This section is followed by a lengthy discussion based on all 11 critical-thinking questions.

我们首先呈现一段概述某种观点的文章，该观点认为各州应该征税以确保个人健康。接下来，我们将基于全部11个批判性思维问题展开深入讨论。

Self-discipline seems to be extraordinarily difficult for us. One area in which we see this lack of self-discipline is health, specifically with diet and exercise. People too often lack motivation to exercise on a regular basis. Although individuals typically think of exercise as a private matter, they are generally not aware of the consequences of their apathy on the well-being of others. If people were more aware of the detrimental effects that their not exercising has on themselves and on other people as well, perhaps they would be more motivated to visit the gym.
自律对我们来说似乎格外困难。这种自律的缺失在健康领域尤为明显，特别是饮食和运动方面。人们常常缺乏定期锻炼的动力。虽然人们通常认为锻炼是私事，但他们往往意识不到自己的冷漠会对他人的健康造成怎样的影响。如果人们能更清楚地意识到不锻炼对自身和他人的不利影响，或许他们会更有动力去健身房。
But they are not. Hence, we need something more than an appeal to self-discipline to encourage healthy behavior. To fulfill this need, states should be permitted to impose taxes on individuals, primarily those who are seriously overweight or obese, for their failure to comply with state-mandated exercise and dieting programs.
但事实并非如此。因此，仅仅呼吁自律不足以鼓励健康行为。为了满足这一需求，各州应被允许对未能遵守州政府强制规定的运动和节食计划的个人征税，尤其是那些严重超重或肥胖的人。
Statistics show that only 3 out of 10 people exercise regularly. Unfortunately, these individuals who do not exercise, in combination with their unhealthy eating habits, have a higher risk of developing certain life-threatening illnesses, like heart attacks, strokes, cancer, and diabetes. For instance, a diet that is high in fat and cholesterol leads to a buildup in the arteries, potentially causing a heart attack when the buildup occurs in an artery carrying blood to the heart, or causing a stroke when the buildup restricts blood flow to the brain.
统计数据显示，只有十分之三的人经常锻炼。不幸的是，这些不锻炼的人，再加上不健康的饮食习惯，患上某些危及生命的疾病的风险更高，例如心脏病、中风、癌症和糖尿病。例如，高脂肪和高胆固醇的饮食会导致动脉内壁积聚脂肪和胆固醇，当积聚物堵塞通往心脏的动脉时，可能引发心脏病；当积聚物阻塞大脑供血时，则可能导致中风。
Similarly, exercise forces your heart to pump more blood, increasing your body's efficiency and possibly reducing the bad cholesterol in your body that could clog your arteries. But those persons who neglect healthier food and regular exercise run a higher risk of developing these kinds of diseases. Regular exercise and a healthy diet could also reduce the risk of prostate cancer and Type 2 diabetes, as individuals who maintain a high-fiber diet could slow prostate cancer cell growth by 30%, and individuals who reduce their sugar consumption also reduce
同样，运动能迫使心脏泵出更多血液，提高身体效率，并可能降低体内可能导致动脉阻塞的“坏”胆固醇。但那些忽视健康饮食和规律运动的人患此类疾病的风险更高。规律运动和健康饮食还可以降低患前列腺癌和2型糖尿病的风险，因为高纤维饮食的人可以将前列腺癌细胞的生长速度减缓30%，而减少糖摄入量的人也能降低患前列腺癌和2型糖尿病的风险。
But beyond the physical benefits of regular exercise and a good diet, individuals also are more likely to experience better mental acuity when they adopt a healthier lifestyle. Brain research suggests that demanding exercise produces greater numbers of nerve cells, which may enhance memory skills. This benefit of better mental acuity due to exercise extends to the entire community, in that the community is less likely to have a need to care for unhealthy individuals who lack the mental capacity to care for themselves. Furthermore, experts say that another benefit of exercise is that exercise reduces anxiety
除了规律运动和健康饮食带来的身体益处之外，人们养成更健康的生活方式也更有可能提升思维敏锐度。脑科学研究表明，高强度运动能够产生更多神经细胞，从而增强记忆力。运动带来的思维敏锐度提升益处惠及整个社区，因为社区需要照顾那些缺乏自理能力的不健康个体的可能性会降低。此外，专家指出，运动的另一个好处是能够减轻焦虑。
Compare the consequences of poor diet and infrequent exercise on the community with a nation's budget. Just as a person gains weight by taking in more calories than they burn, a nation incurs a greater deficit when spending exceeds what a nation produces. But a government's spending, even when there is a large deficit, does affect not only the government, but the entire nation, just as an unhealthy person, who consumes too much and does not burn many calories, affects the community as well as the individual, while effectively running a
将不良饮食和缺乏运动对社区的影响与国家预算进行比较。正如一个人摄入的热量超过消耗的热量会导致体重增加一样，当一个国家的支出超过其产出时，就会产生更大的赤字。但是，即使存在巨额赤字，政府的支出也不仅仅影响政府自身，而是影响整个国家，正如一个不健康的人，摄入过多热量而消耗过少，不仅影响自身，也影响整个社区，同时有效地维持着国家的运转。
Consider some of the statistics related to obesity, which is caused by a lack of exercise and poor dieting. One recent study found that states are paying $75 billion to treat obesity, indicating that expenditures for obesity are approaching spending levels for treatment of smoking-related illnesses. Because states are using so much money to pay for obesity-related treatments, states are less able to use these limited resources to fund other programs, like services under Medicare and Medicaid. For example, 15.7 percent of California's Medicaid spending is used to treat obesity, meaning that those funds could be used to treat other diseases like most cancers, physical and mental disabilities, and common viral infections. In addition, obesity, unlike many other illnesses, is largely preventable, as individuals suffering from obesity could easily alter their unhealthy condition with regular exercise and a
肥胖症是由缺乏运动和不良饮食习惯造成的，一些统计数据值得关注。最近一项研究发现，各州每年花费750亿美元用于治疗肥胖症，这意味着肥胖症的治疗支出已接近吸烟相关疾病的治疗支出水平。由于各州将大量资金用于肥胖症相关治疗，因此用于资助其他项目（例如联邦医疗保险和医疗补助计划）的资源相对减少。例如，加州15.7%的医疗补助计划支出用于治疗肥胖症，这意味着这些资金本可以用于治疗其他疾病，例如大多数癌症、身心障碍和常见病毒感染。此外，与许多其他疾病不同，肥胖症在很大程度上是可以预防的，因为肥胖症患者可以通过规律运动和合理饮食轻松改善健康状况。
Furthermore, a state tax on individuals who do not regularly exercise and diet would offer an additional source of funding to assist with treatment of obesity-related illnesses because there could be funding for additional research and development to prevent and treat obesity. But supposing these funds were not used to treat obesity-related diseases, they could then be applied in areas outside of healthcare, to pay for educational and social programs, police and fire divisions, or homeland security. Therefore, states, along with communities in general, have a responsibility to encourage healthy lifestyles.
此外，对不经常锻炼和节食的个人征收州税，可以为治疗肥胖相关疾病提供额外的资金来源，因为这些资金可以用于预防和治疗肥胖的研发。但假设这些资金没有用于治疗肥胖相关疾病，它们还可以用于医疗保健以外的领域，例如支付教育和社会项目、警察和消防部门或国土安全费用。因此，各州以及整个社区都有责任鼓励健康的生活方式。
When we consider that many individuals seemingly lack the motivation to exercise and properly diet, the state has every right to intervene, specifically by imposing a sort of health tax on those who do not comply with state exercise and dieting standards. Although this practice may seem somewhat discriminatory, it remains a fact that states and communities in general end up paying for most obesity-related treatments, and a state tax becomes the necessary alternative to individuals' inability to make careful decisions about exercise and diet.
考虑到许多人似乎缺乏锻炼和合理饮食的动力，政府完全有权进行干预，特别是对那些不遵守州政府规定的锻炼和饮食标准的人征收某种形式的健康税。尽管这种做法可能看起来有些歧视性，但事实是，大多数与肥胖相关的治疗费用最终都由州政府和社区承担，而州政府征税就成了弥补个人缺乏谨慎锻炼和饮食决策能力的必要手段。

What Are the Issue and the Conclusion?

问题是什么？结论是什么？

The issue addressed in the previous passage is a prescriptive one: Should states be permitted to tax citizens who fail to meet exercise and dieting requirements? We know that this is the issue because of what the author seeks to prove. The author's reasons all support the conclusion that yes, states have the right to tax individuals who do not meet exercise and dieting requirements. The reasons emphasize problems for the community from a lack of exercise and proper nutrition of individuals, while highlighting the futility in our relying on individuals to alter their own behavior for the public good.

前文探讨的问题是一个规范性问题：各州是否应该被允许对未能达到运动和饮食要求的公民征税？我们知道这是问题的关键所在，因为作者试图证明这一点。作者的所有论证都支持这样的结论：是的，各州有权对未能达到运动和饮食要求的个人征税。这些论证强调了缺乏运动和营养对社会造成的危害，同时也指出，指望个人为了公共利益而改变自身行为是徒劳的。

What Are the Reasons?

原因是什么？

Let's paraphrase the reasons that lead to the conclusion that states should impose taxes on individuals who do not comply with exercise and dieting standards.

让我们概括一下得出“各州应该对不遵守锻炼和节食标准的个人征税”这一结论的原因。

  1. Most people lack motivation to alter their behavior to benefit the community.
    大多数人缺乏改变自身行为以造福社会的动力。
  2. Individuals' not exercising and eating well increases the risk of developing life-threatening diseases.
    Supporting reason: Heart attacks, strokes, cancer, and diabetes are associated with infrequent exercise and a poor diet.
    缺乏运动和不健康饮食会增加罹患危及生命的疾病的风险。
    支持理由：心脏病、中风、癌症和糖尿病都与缺乏运动和不良饮食习惯有关。
  3. Proper exercise promotes mental acuity, and this effect frees up caretaker time needed for those lacking self-care ability.
    Supporting reason: Brain research suggests that demanding exercise builds nerve cells, which helps memory.
    适当的锻炼可以提高思维敏捷度，从而为缺乏自理能力的人腾出照护者所需的时间。
    支持性理由：脑科学研究表明，高强度锻炼可以促进神经细胞的生长，从而有助于记忆。
  4. People who exercise experience less stress and anxiety.
    经常锻炼的人压力和焦虑感会降低。
  5. Obesity has resulted in high levels of state spending.
    Supporting reason: People who do not exercise or eat a nutritious diet are more likely to be obese.
    Supporting reason two: State spending to treat obesity-related diseases is approaching levels to treat illnesses related to cigarette smoking.
    肥胖导致国家支出居高不下。
    佐证理由：不运动或饮食不健康的人更容易肥胖。
    佐证理由二：国家用于治疗肥胖相关疾病的支出已接近用于治疗吸烟相关疾病的支出水平。
  6. Diseases and problems related to poor dieting and exercise are largely preventable.
    与不良饮食习惯和缺乏运动相关的疾病和问题在很大程度上是可以预防的。
  7. A state tax would provide funding for treatment of obesity and research to help prevent obesity.
    州税将为肥胖症的治疗和预防肥胖症的研究提供资金。
  8. Money spent on treating diseases related to obesity could be used elsewhere.
    用于治疗肥胖相关疾病的资金本可以用于其他方面。

What Words or Phrases Are Ambiguous?

哪些词语或短语具有歧义？

We look first for possible ambiguity that might weaken the reasoning presented by focusing on the author's major reasons. An important ambiguity pervades the entire argument. What precisely is meant by "regular exercise?"

我们首先通过关注作者的主要论点来寻找可能削弱论证的歧义。一个重要的歧义贯穿整个论证：究竟什么是“定期锻炼”？

The phrase may appear clear, but it could be interpreted in several different ways. Notice how your reaction to the author's emphasis on regular exercise would be affected by the choice of either of the following alternative definitions of regular exercise.

这句话看似清晰明了，但实际上可以有几种不同的解读。请注意，如果你选择以下两种对“规律运动”的不同定义，你对作者强调规律运动的看法会有何不同。

A. Weightlifting 3—4 days each week.
A. 每周举重 3-4 天。
B. Participating in 30 minutes of cardiovascular exercise four days each week.
B. 每周四天进行 30 分钟的有氧运动。
C. Spending three hours in the gym Monday through Friday.
C. 周一至周五每天在健身房锻炼三个小时。

If you believe, for example, that individuals should exercise only three days every week, you may be less supportive of the conclusion if the writer means the third definition. You might believe that such a stringent exercise routine would place undue hardship upon an individual and his or her family, as people would possibly spend more time in the gym than with their families.

例如，如果您认为人们每周只需锻炼三天，那么如果作者指的是第三种定义，您可能就不会那么认同这个结论了。您或许会认为，如此严格的锻炼计划会给个人及其家庭带来不必要的负担，因为人们可能会把更多的时间花在健身房而不是陪伴家人上。

In addition, the passage does not specify who should regularly exercise. Does the author think that all adults must regularly exercise, or only adults older than 40 who have a higher risk of developing certain illnesses? Child obesity is arguably a growing problem. Would the author recommend that children regularly exercise or else be taxed as well?

此外，文章并未明确指出哪些人应该经常锻炼。作者是认为所有成年人都必须经常锻炼，还是只有40岁以上、患病风险较高的成年人才应该经常锻炼？儿童肥胖无疑是一个日益严重的问题。作者是否建议儿童也应该经常锻炼，否则就应该对他们征税？

Clearly, we might agree or disagree with the conclusion depending on the meaning of regular exercise; thus the phrase is an important ambiguity.

显然，我们可能会同意或不同意这一结论，这取决于“经常锻炼”的含义；因此，这个短语存在重要的歧义。

The fourth reason includes another important ambiguity—stress and anxiety. Our willingness to see this reason as strongly supporting the conclusion will depend on our sense of the kind, frequency, and severity of such stress and anxiety.

第四个原因还包含另一个重要的模糊之处——压力和焦虑。我们是否愿意将这一原因视为有力地支持结论，取决于我们对这类压力和焦虑的种类、频率和严重程度的感知。

What are the Value Conflicts and Assumptions?

价值冲突和假设是什么？

The essay presents an interesting study in value conflicts. To appreciate these value conflicts, you must first uncover a value assumption necessary for the issue to even be phrased as it is. Before debating whether states should tax people for failing to exercise and diet according to state standards, we should realize that to some extent exercise and dieting is a matter of individual preference. Some individuals choose to exercise, while others rarely, if ever, exercise or diet. The author of the passage values the right of the individual to make choices on some level. But on another level, the author seems quite willing to put autonomy on hold for this particular issue.

这篇文章对价值冲突进行了有趣的探讨。要理解这些价值冲突，首先必须揭示出问题得以如此表述所必需的价值假设。在讨论各州是否应该对未按州标准进行锻炼和节食的人征税之前，我们应该意识到，在某种程度上，锻炼和节食是个人偏好的问题。有些人选择锻炼，而有些人则很少锻炼或节食，甚至从不锻炼或节食。文章作者在某种程度上重视个人做出选择的权利。但另一方面，作者似乎又愿意在这个特定问题上暂时搁置这种自主权。

The individual's right to choose conflicts with another underlying value: Collective responsibility. The argument for states' imposing a kind of health tax rests on the notion that states have a collective responsibility to ensure that individuals exercise and diet for the benefit of the community. The author suggests that behavior not be primarily based on what individuals believe to be in their best interest, but suggests that individual behavior should be based on that which is beneficial to the entire community. Thus, a value preference for collective responsibility over individual responsibility clearly influences the author's choice of reasons and conclusion.

个人选择权与另一项根本价值——集体责任——相冲突。支持国家征收某种健康税的论点基于这样一种理念：国家负有集体责任，确保个人为了社区的利益而进行锻炼和合理饮食。作者认为，个人行为不应主要基于个人认为符合自身利益的考量，而应基于对整个社区有益的考量。因此，作者对集体责任而非个人责任的价值偏好，显然影响了其论证和结论的选择。

Another value priority can be detected by linking the first and sixth reasons to the conclusion. Cooperation is favored over autonomy and comfort. Suggesting that individuals meet state-established goals of exercise and dieting reflects a preference for a certain means toward meeting these goals, viz., cooperation through state action. Cooperation conflicts with individuals' rights to make decisions about their own bodies and lifestyles. Such an approach places autonomy and comfort lower in our value priorities in the hope that diseases would be more frequently prevented.

通过将第一条和第六条理由与结论联系起来，可以发现另一种价值优先顺序。合作优先于自主和舒适。建议个人达到国家设定的运动和节食目标，反映出人们偏好通过某种特定方式来实现这些目标，即通过国家行动进行合作。合作与个人自主决定自身身体和生活方式的权利相冲突。这种方法将自主和舒适置于我们价值优先顺序的较低位置，希望以此更有效地预防疾病。

What Are the Descriptive Assumptions?

描述性假设是什么？

For the first reason, if true, to support the conclusion, it is necessary to assume that the state tax will provide sufficient motivation for individuals to modify their behavior. This descriptive assumption is questionable. It is quite possible that many individuals will be so upset by state-sanctioned exercise and dieting programs that those who are overweight, and perhaps even those individuals who regularly exercise, would engage in widespread civil disobedience, avoiding exercise and refusing to pay the new tax. Implicit in the passage is a view of individuals as rational in the sense that they would respond to monetary incentives in the form of tax savings to live a healthier lifestyle. If we believe this may not be the case, then we are likely to question the degree to which this reason supports the conclusion.

第一个理由，如果成立，要支持结论，就必须假设州税足以激励个人改变行为。然而，这种描述性假设值得商榷。很可能许多人会对州政府认可的锻炼和节食计划感到不满，以至于超重者，甚至可能包括那些经常锻炼的人，都会发起大规模的公民不服从运动，拒绝锻炼并拒绝缴纳新税。这段文字隐含着一种观点，即个人是理性的，他们会对税收优惠等经济激励做出反应，从而选择更健康的生活方式。如果我们认为事实并非如此，那么我们就会对这一理由在多大程度上支持结论提出质疑。

A second significant descriptive assumption underlies the author's claims that obesity is linked to numerous diseases and mental problems. For these reasons to be supportive of the conclusion, the author is assuming that compliance with the state exercise and dieting program will reduce the number of instances of obesity-related diseases. However, the author does not provide substantial evidence to justify this assumption, making this descriptive assumption questionable.

第二个重要的描述性假设是作者声称肥胖与多种疾病和心理问题相关这一论断的基础。为了支持这一结论，作者假定遵守政府的运动和饮食计划能够减少肥胖相关疾病的发生率。然而，作者并未提供充分的证据来支持这一假设，因此该描述性假设值得怀疑。

Another descriptive assumption important to the argument is related to the eighth reason. The truth of this reason depends on the assumption that money not spent on obesity-related treatments will be used effectively in other programs, such as police and fire departments, homeland security, and education. In other words, this money will be used to strengthen these other programs. However, if we doubt the likelihood that money saved from obesity-related treatments would be effectively used in other programs that we deem important, we would be less likely to support the conclusion that states should place a tax on individuals if they fail to regularly exercise and diet.

另一个对论证至关重要的描述性假设与第八个理由相关。该理由的真假取决于这样一个假设：未用于肥胖相关治疗的资金将被有效用于其他项目，例如警察和消防部门、国土安全和教育。换句话说，这些资金将用于加强这些其他项目。然而，如果我们怀疑从肥胖相关治疗中节省下来的资金能否有效用于我们认为重要的其他项目，我们就不太可能支持“如果个人未能定期锻炼和控制饮食，各州应该对其征税”这一结论。

Are There Any Fallacies in the Reasoning?

这种推理是否存在谬误？

Several fallacies seriously damage the argument. First, the author diverts our attention from the real issues by using emotional language. Phrases like "consequences of their apathy," "detrimental effects," "life-threatening illnesses," and "health deficit," for example, create a negative emotional association to obesity. Also, phrases like "largely preventable" and "nutritious and well-balanced diet" tend to be positive buzz words that create a positive association to the author's position. This tactic diverts our attention from the larger issue and from specific, relevant reasons, such as advantages and disadvantages of state laws that regulate exercise and diet.

几个谬误严重削弱了论证。首先，作者使用情绪化的语言，转移了我们对真正问题的注意力。例如，“冷漠的后果”、“有害影响”、“危及生命的疾病”和“健康缺陷”等词语，使人们对肥胖产生了负面的情感联想。此外，诸如“很大程度上可以预防”和“营养均衡的饮食”之类的词语，往往是积极的宣传语，使人们对作者的观点产生正面的联想。这种策略转移了我们对更广泛问题的关注，也使我们忽略了具体相关的原因，例如各州关于运动和饮食监管的法律的利弊。

Second, the argument includes the False Dilemma fallacy. The first reason suggests that individuals lack discipline to regularly exercise and maintain a healthy diet. The author also mentions that "a state tax becomes the necessary alternative to individuals' making decisions about exercise and diet." For this statement to be true, the author must assume that there are only two choices: either individuals make decisions about their exercise and health in such a way that individuals and the community benefit from improving health, or the state must create a health program and tax those who fail to comply. Obviously, these are not the only alternatives to the issue. Other solutions are possible, as you will see when we discuss alternative conclusions.

其次，该论证犯了虚假两难谬误。第一个理由暗示个人缺乏自律，无法定期锻炼和保持健康饮食。作者还提到，“州税成为个人做出锻炼和饮食决定的必要替代方案”。要使这一说法成立，作者必须假定只有两种选择：要么个人做出有利于自身和社区健康的锻炼和健康决策，要么州政府必须制定健康计划并对不遵守计划的人征税。显然，这并非解决问题的唯一途径。正如我们将在讨论其他结论时看到的，还有其他解决方案。

How Good Is the Evidence?

证据有多充分？

First, we ask the question, is there any evidence for the claims? There is. Then, we should ask, what kinds of evidence does the author provide? The author cites several research studies, an analogy, and an appeal to authority as evidence. A close look at the evidence reveals a lack of good evidence.

首先，我们要问的是，这些论断是否有证据支持？答案是肯定的。其次，我们应该问，作者提供了哪些类型的证据？作者引用了几项研究、一个类比以及诉诸权威作为证据。仔细审视这些证据，就会发现缺乏有效的证据。

The governmental spending analogy in the fourth paragraph is offered as evidence that individuals' choosing not to exercise affects the entire community. Relevant similarities exist between a governmental body making decisions about spending and an individual's decision about her health, such as the desirability of making careful decisions that take others' interests into account.

第四段中以政府支出为例，证明个人选择不锻炼会影响整个社区。政府机构在支出决策和个人在健康决策之间存在诸多相似之处，例如，两者都应谨慎决策，兼顾他人利益。

The differences, however, weaken the value of the analogy as evidence. One relevant difference relates to the author's comparison of one part to the whole. The author argues that an individual affects the community as a government affects the nation. However, in the former situation, an individual is a part of a community, which is composed of numerous individuals. But a government is not similar, in the sense that a nation is not made up of numerous governments, but numerous citizens. The analogy fails to consider that in one case two similar entities are being compared, while the other situation involves two distinctly different entities. A second major difference is the role that the smaller entity plays in each situation. Individuals typically do not make decisions about health on the basis of potential consequences to the community, regardless of how much the author believes people should; however, governments at minimum operate with the rhetoric of public interest in the forefront of their discussions. A third difference is that at times governmental decisions, such as running a deficit for several years, could be beneficial for a nation that was experiencing unemployment and needed additional spending to stimulate job creation. However, the author would seemingly not agree that being obese for several years could be beneficial to a community.

然而，这些差异削弱了该类比作为证据的价值。一个相关的差异在于作者将部分与整体进行比较。作者认为，个人对社区的影响如同政府对国家的影响。然而，在前一种情况下，个人是社区的一部分，而社区由众多个人组成。但政府的情况并非如此，因为一个国家并非由众多政府组成，而是由众多公民组成。该类比忽略了两种情况的本质区别：一种情况比较的是两个相似的实体，而另一种情况则涉及两个截然不同的实体。第二个主要差异在于较小实体在两种情况下所扮演的角色。无论作者多么认为人们应该这样做，个人通常不会基于对社区的潜在影响来做出健康方面的决定；然而，政府至少在决策过程中会将公共利益置于首要位置。第三个差异是，有时政府的某些决策，例如连续几年维持财政赤字，可能对一个正经历失业、需要额外支出以刺激就业的国家有利。然而，作者似乎并不认同多年肥胖会对社区有益。

The third reason points to brain research as evidence that exercise enhances mental acuity. This information is weak, however, because information about the research is lacking, leaving important questions unanswered.

第三个理由援引脑科学研究作为证据，认为运动可以提高思维敏锐度。然而，这一信息并不充分，因为缺乏关于该研究的详细信息，导致一些重要问题仍未得到解答。

What is the source of this research? How many times have these kinds of studies been replicated? How many individuals in these studies were tested? Were the tests of mental acuity given to a random sample, involving individuals of various backgrounds, ages, health conditions, etc.? Without a more detailed description of the cited brain research, such research cannot be considered as helpful evidence.

这项研究的来源是什么？这类研究被重复验证过多少次？这些研究中测试了多少人？这些智力测试是否针对随机样本，包括不同背景、年龄、健康状况等的个体？如果没有对所引用的脑科学研究进行更详细的描述，这类研究就不能被视为有用的证据。

Similarly, the author's appeal to expert testimony in the fourth reason as evidence that exercise reduces stress and anxiety suffers from a lack of important information. The author provides no reference to the study or how frequently these kinds of studies have been replicated. In addition, the author does not describe the ways in which the studies were conducted. Consider, for example, the possible differences in results from experts' testing the stress levels of a group of retirees in one study from parents who have multiple jobs in another study.

同样，作者在第四个理由中援引专家证词来证明运动可以减轻压力和焦虑，但这一论点缺乏重要信息。作者没有提供相关研究的参考文献，也没有说明此类研究的重复次数。此外，作者也没有描述这些研究的具体方法。例如，一项研究中专家测试的是一群退休人员的压力水平，而另一项研究中专家测试的是一群身兼多职的父母的压力水平，两者的结果可能存在差异。

Are There Rival Causes?

是否存在其他竞争原因？

Support for the fifth reason is based on the association between exercise and obesity, implying that a lack of the former causes the latter. But correlation does not prove causation! Rival causes can explain the relationship. For example, individuals who have a very low metabolism are more likely to be obese, regardless of their level of physical activity. Genetics could pre-dispose certain individuals to be obese, even though these individuals might exercise regularly.

第五个理由的依据是运动与肥胖之间的关联，暗示缺乏运动会导致肥胖。但相关性并不等同于因果关系！其他因素也可能解释这种关联。例如，新陈代谢极低的人更容易肥胖，无论他们的运动量如何。遗传因素也可能使某些人更容易肥胖，即使他们经常锻炼。

Are the Statistics Deceptive?

统计数据具有欺骗性吗？

Some of the statistics deceive us by proving one thing while concluding another. For example, the author of the passage describes the number of individuals who do not exercise regularly. The statistic that 3 out of 10 people exercise regularly, however, proves only that of those people surveyed 3 out of 10 exercise regularly. It certainly does not prove that 7 out of 10 also have a poor diet and are at a higher risk for developing life-threatening diseases. In fact, the statistic tells us nothing about dieting or risk of developing diseases.

有些统计数据会误导我们，它们表面上证明了一件事，实际上却得出了另一结论。例如，文章作者描述了不经常锻炼的人数。然而，10个人中有3个经常锻炼的统计数据，仅仅证明了在接受调查的这些人中，有3个经常锻炼。它当然不能证明10个人中有7个饮食不健康，更容易患上危及生命的疾病。事实上，这个统计数据并没有告诉我们任何关于饮食或患病风险的信息。

Also, the statistic that people who maintain a high-fiber diet could slow prostate cell growth by 30% is obviously meant to illustrate one particular benefit of a high-fiber diet. But this statistic in its strongest form proves only that individuals who consume high amounts of fiber could slow the growth of prostate cancer by 30%, not that they are 30% less likely to develop some form of prostate cancer. In addition, this statistic says nothing about the role of exercise in the development of prostate cancer, nor does the statistic mention any other ways in which a healthy diet, apart from consuming large amounts of fiber, contributes to the likelihood of slowing prostate cancer cell growth. Important missing information about the role of exercise and diet in general is needed to substantiate the author's claim that exercise and diet reduce the risk of prostate cancer.

此外，文中提到的“高纤维饮食可使前列腺细胞生长减缓30%”这一数据，显然旨在说明高纤维饮食的某项特定益处。然而，该数据最强有力的解释也只能说明摄入大量纤维的人可能使前列腺癌的生长减缓30%，而非他们患某种前列腺癌的几率降低30%。此外，该数据并未提及运动在前列腺癌发展中的作用，也没有提及健康饮食（除摄入大量纤维外）如何以其他方式减缓前列腺癌细胞的生长。要证实作者关于运动和饮食能够降低前列腺癌风险的论断，需要补充关于运动和饮食在前列腺癌发展中作用的重要信息。

What Significant Information Is Omitted?

遗漏了哪些重要信息？

Because this argument, like nearly all arguments, has incomplete reasoning, the amount of information omitted is enormous. To sort through the passage's unanswered questions, you should focus on the most significant of the omitted information.

因为这个论证（几乎所有论证都是如此）的推理并不完整，所以遗漏的信息量非常大。为了理清文章中未解答的问题，你应该重点关注那些被遗漏的最重要信息。

First, we should ask whether the author has provided reasons for why we should reject common counterarguments. For example, what reasons would someone provide who disagrees with the author's conclusion? The author does not discuss reasons why others might disagree with her reasoning. But were we to be more familiar with these common counterarguments, perhaps we would react differently to the author's reasoning.

首先，我们应该问问作者是否提供了驳斥常见反驳论点的理由。例如，如果有人不同意作者的结论，他们会给出哪些理由？作者并没有讨论其他人可能不同意她论证的原因。但如果我们更熟悉这些常见的反驳论点，或许我们对作者的论证会有不同的反应。

Specific information about the association between exercise and dieting with mental acuity and stress would be helpful in the third and fourth reasons. In addition, interviews with people of various ages and backgrounds might suggest hypotheses about the impact of state laws that regulate exercise and diet.

关于运动和饮食与思维敏锐度和压力之间关联的具体信息，将有助于解释第三和第四个原因。此外，对不同年龄和背景的人进行访谈，或许能够提出关于州法律对运动和饮食监管影响的假设。

Also, the author fails to consider the potential negative effects of allowing states to tax individuals who do not exercise and diet according to state standards. One such effect of states' regulating health is the possibility that exercise and eating, which are typically regarded as leisure activities, will be viewed largely as a means of avoiding punishment by taxation. In other words, instead of states' touting the importance of exercise and dieting for their benefits to health and the enjoyment of these leisure activities, the primary benefit might become avoidance of the health tax, nullifying many of the reasons for why people now choose a healthy lifestyle. Another possible negative effect is that state governments will have difficulty in monitoring individuals' exercise and dieting patterns. To implement this law effectively, states may spend more money on monitoring individuals than they are accumulating through increased taxes and healthcare savings from fewer treatments. Because the cost of healthcare for obesity-related treatments is such a significant reason in the author's argument, any evidence that might suggest that states would need to spend large amounts of money to apply the health law would make us seriously question the author's reasoning.

此外，作者未能考虑到允许各州对未按州标准进行锻炼和节食的个人征税可能带来的负面影响。其中一种影响是，通常被视为休闲活动的运动和饮食，可能会被人们视为逃避税收惩罚的手段。换句话说，各州不再宣传运动和节食对健康的益处以及享受这些休闲活动的重要性，而是将其主要目的变成了规避健康税，从而使人们选择健康生活方式的许多理由失效。另一个可能的负面影响是，州政府将难以监控个人的运动和节食模式。为了有效实施这项法律，各州可能需要花费更多资金用于监控个人，而不是通过增加税收和减少治疗费用节省下来的医疗开支。由于肥胖相关治疗的医疗成本是作者论证中的一个重要因素，任何表明各州需要花费大量资金来实施这项健康法律的证据，都会使我们对作者的论证产生严重的质疑。

Another potential negative effect is more long term. The implementation of these laws might open the floodgates for more infringement on the rights of individuals. The argument is a classic one: If rights can be curbed in one instance, then why not this or that instance? The commonality of the argument should not, however, dissuade us from considering its validity. If the reasoning for health laws is found acceptable and similar reasoning is applied to other issues, then it is very probable that the reasoning will be accepted again. Before becoming a proponent for this or any argument, you should carefully consider the potential long-term effects of the action.

另一个潜在的负面影响是长期的。这些法律的实施可能会打开侵犯个人权利的闸门。这种论点很常见：如果权利在一种情况下可以被限制，那么为什么在其他情况下就不行呢？然而，这种论点的普遍性不应阻止我们考虑其合理性。如果健康法律的理由被认为是可接受的，并且类似的理由被应用于其他问题，那么这种理由很可能再次被接受。在支持这种论点或任何其他论点之前，您应该仔细考虑该行动可能产生的长期影响。

What Reasonable Conclusions Are Possible?

有哪些合理的结论是可能的？

Let's first list the reasons that we were least able to criticize—recognizing that all of the reasoning has some flaws. Next we will identify alternative conclusions consistent with these reasons.

首先，让我们列出那些我们最难以反驳的理由——当然，我们也承认所有这些论证都存在一些缺陷。接下来，我们将找出与这些理由相符的其他结论。

  1. Individuals' not exercising and eating well increases their risk of developing life-threatening diseases.
    缺乏运动和不健康饮食会增加罹患危及生命的疾病的风险。
  2. Obesity has resulted in high levels of state spending.
    肥胖问题导致国家支出居高不下。

Remember that we are looking for conclusions other than the one provided by the author that are reasonable, given the most compelling reasons.

请记住，我们寻找的是作者给出的结论之外的其他合理结论，这些结论必须有最令人信服的理由。

One alternative conclusion that is consistent with both strong reasons is that communities could develop programs to educate the people within their communities about the importance of exercise and nutrition. Perhaps these educational programs would make people more aware of the increased risks associated with a lack of exercise and nutrition and would encourage others to visit the gym, thereby reducing the amount of spending needed to treat obesity. Another plausible conclusion is that states could limit how much they spend on obesity-related illnesses. Such limitations might increase the likelihood that individuals would respond by adopting a healthier lifestyle, realizing that states will not pay for treatments of diseases that are linked to obesity, particularly if conditions of obesity could have been mitigated by exercise and nutrition.

另一种与上述两个有力理由相符的结论是，社区可以制定计划，教育社区居民了解运动和营养的重要性。这些教育计划或许能让人们更加意识到缺乏运动和营养所带来的风险，并鼓励他们去健身房锻炼，从而减少治疗肥胖所需的支出。另一个合理的结论是，各州可以限制在肥胖相关疾病上的支出。这种限制可能会促使人们采取更健康的生活方式，因为他们意识到州政府不会为与肥胖相关的疾病的治疗买单，尤其是在肥胖问题可以通过运动和营养得到改善的情况下。

If people lack motivation to exercise due in part to limited access to expensive gyms with a large variety of equipment, classes, and trainers, then another possible alternative conclusion is that states should open gyms that provide cheaper access to the public, especially for individuals of higher health risks.

如果人们缺乏锻炼的动力，部分原因是他们难以接触到配备各种器材、课程和教练的昂贵健身房，那么另一种可能的结论是，各州应该开设价格更低廉的健身房，让公众，特别是那些健康风险较高的人群，能够更方便地使用健身房。

Our critical discussion responds to only some of the facets of the controversy over whether states should tax people who do not exercise and eat well. You may focus on other parts of the argument. Ultimately, if you care about this issue, you must decide which of the inferences to support. Critical thinking can take you only so far. The final step is yours.

我们的批判性讨论仅回应了关于各州是否应该对不运动、不健康饮食的人征税这一争议的部分方面。您可以关注论证的其他部分。最终，如果您关心这个问题，您必须决定支持哪些推论。批判性思维只能带您走到这一步，最后一步取决于您自己。

You can feel relatively confident that after following our question checklist, you have asked the right questions about the arguments and you are well prepared to form a reasoned opinion of your own about the quality of the author's reasoning. To reach your own decision on this issue, we recommend that you seek out more relevant information and choose the reasons and values that are most consistent with what you know and what you care about.

您可以比较有信心，按照我们的提问清单进行提问后，您已经就论点提出了正确的问题，并做好了充分的准备，能够对作者的论证质量形成自己合理的判断。为了就此问题做出您自己的决定，我们建议您寻找更多相关信息，并选择与您的认知和关注点最相符的理由和价值观。

#↩

Final Word

结语

Critical thinking is a tool. It does something for you. In serving this function for you, critical thinking can perform well or not so well. We want to end the book by urging you to get optimal use of the attitudes and skills of critical thinking that you have worked so hard to develop.

批判性思维是一种工具，它能为你带来益处。然而，批判性思维在发挥这种作用的过程中，其效果可能很好，也可能不尽如人意。本书的结尾，我们衷心希望你能充分利用你辛辛苦苦培养的批判性思维的态度和技能。

The Tone of Your Critical Thinking

批判性思维的基调

As a critical thinker, you have the capability to come across like an annoying warrior, constantly watching for ways to slay those who stray from careful reasoning. But learning is, in important ways, a social activity. We need one another for development; we need one another to share conversation and debate. None of us is so gifted that we can stand alone in the face of the complexities we encounter. Critical thinking can make you more self-reliant if you use it to improve your own decision-making.

作为一名批判性思考者，你可能会像个令人讨厌的战士，时刻寻找机会击溃那些不按常理出牌的人。但学习在很多方面都是一种社交活动。我们需要彼此才能成长；我们需要彼此交流和辩论。没有人天赋异禀到可以独自应对遇到的种种复杂问题。如果你能运用批判性思维来提升自己的决策能力，它就能让你更加独立自主。

Hence, critical thinkers need to think about what they are giving off when they use their critical thinking. When you use your critical thinking, you are sending some kind of message to others about what critical thinking means to you. This message will be especially effective when it combines the curiosity and excitement of the child with the skeptical nature of our best scientists, all moderated by the humility of a monk. Your critical thinking then is on display as a pathway to better conclusions. You seek those conclusions not to elevate yourself above those who have other conclusions, but to move us all forward toward some better understanding of who we are. And all the while, you will be improving yourself as a thinker.

因此，批判性思考者需要思考，当他们运用批判性思维时，他们传递了什么信息。当你运用批判性思维时，你实际上是在向他人传递某种信息，告诉他们批判性思维对你而言意味着什么。当你的批判性思维能够将孩童般的好奇与热情、顶尖科学家般的怀疑精神，以及僧侣般的谦逊融为一体时，这种信息将尤为有效。如此一来，你的批判性思维便展现为通往更佳结论的途径。你追求这些结论并非为了凌驾于持有其他结论的人之上，而是为了推动我们所有人更好地理解自身。而在此过程中，你也将不断提升自身的思考能力。

Criticism is always a tricky business. In many families and schools, disagreement is identified with meanness. In these settings, the preferred social role is smiling agreement with whatever reasoning is announced. As a critical thinker, you must consider the stark sound of your critical questions in such a context and work self-consciously to make certain that your critical thinking is seen in its best light.

批评总是一件棘手的事情。在许多家庭和学校里，异议被视为刻薄。在这样的环境中，人们更倾向于微笑表示赞同，无论对方提出什么理由。作为一名批判性思考者，你必须意识到在这种语境下，你的批判性问题听起来有多么刺耳，并自觉地努力确保你的批判性思维能够以最佳方式被看待。

Your best strategy is to present yourself as someone, who like the person who made the argument in the first place is stumbling around, but always watchful for better conclusions. Openness is a central value of a critical thinker, and you show that openness by your eagerness to listen and discover. Whoever finds the better conclusion first is not relevant; what is important is the search for better conclusions. If you give signals to those trying to persuade you that you are their partner in a discovery process intended to enrich you both, they may see your critical questions as a tool that is indispensable to both of you.

你最好的策略是把自己塑造成一个和最初提出论点的人一样，也在摸索前进，但始终保持警惕，寻求更佳结论的人。开放的心态是批判性思考者的核心价值，而你渴望倾听和探索的态度正是这种开放心态的体现。谁先找到更佳结论并不重要；重要的是不断探索更佳结论的过程。如果你向那些试图说服你的人传递出这样的信号：你是他们探索过程中的伙伴，旨在共同提升彼此的认知，那么他们或许会将你提出的批判性问题视为对你们双方都不可或缺的工具。

Strategies for Effective Critical Thinking

有效批判性思维策略

How can you give others the sense that your critical thinking is a friendly tool, one that can improve the lives of the listener and the speaker, the reader, and the writer? Like other critical thinkers, we are always struggling with this question.

如何让别人觉得你的批判性思维是一种友好的工具，能够改善听众、发言者、读者和作者的生活？和其他批判性思考者一样，我们一直在努力思考这个问题。

Let us conclude this book with a few of the techniques we try to use.

让我们以我们尝试使用的一些技巧来结束本书。

  1. Be certain to demonstrate that you really want to grasp what is being said. Ask questions that indicate your willingness to grasp and accept new conclusions.
    务必表现出你真心想理解对方所说的话。提出一些问题，表明你愿意理解并接受新的结论。
  2. Restate what you heard or read and ask whether your understanding of the argument is consistent with what was written or spoken.
    复述你听到或读到的内容，并询问你对论点的理解是否与书面或口头内容一致。
  3. Voice your critical questions as if you are curious. Nothing is more deadly to the effective use of critical thinking than an attitude of "Aha, I caught you making an error."
    提出批判性问题时，要表现得充满好奇。没有什么比“啊哈，我发现你犯错了”这种态度更能阻碍批判性思维的有效运用了。
  4. Request additional reasons that might enable the person to make a stronger argument than the one originally provided.
    要求对方提供更多理由，以便提出比最初提供的理由更有力的论点。
  5. Work hard to keep the conversation going. If critical thinking is deployed like a bomb, thinking on that topic is halted.
    努力让对话持续下去。如果批判性思维像炸弹一样被抛出去，那么对该话题的思考就会停止。
  6. Ask the other person for permission to allow you to explore any weaknesses in the reasoning. The idea with this strategy is to encourage the other person to examine the argument with you.
    征得对方的同意，以便探究其论证中的任何薄弱环节。这种策略的目的是鼓励对方与你一起审视论点。
  7. Convey the impression that you and the other person are collaborators, working toward the same objective - improved conclusions.
    给人留下这样的印象：你和对方是合作者，朝着同一个目标努力——取得更好的结论。

As a parting shot, we want to encourage you to engage with issues. Critical thinking is not a sterile hobby. It provides a basis for a partnership for action among the reasonable. Beliefs are wonderful, but their payoff is in our subsequent behavior. After you have found the best answer to a question, act on that answer. Make your critical thinking the basis for the creation of an identity of which you can be proud. Put it to work for yourself and for the community in which you find yourself.

最后，我们想鼓励你积极参与各种议题。批判性思维并非枯燥的爱好，它能为理性之人携手行动奠定基础。信念固然美好，但其价值体现在我们后续的行动中。找到问题的最佳答案后，请付诸行动。让批判性思维成为你构建引以为傲的身份认同的基石，并将其应用于自身发展以及你所在的社群建设。

#↩

介绍

批判性思维来帮忙
The Sponge and Panning for Gold: Alternative Thinking Styles
海绵和淘金：另类思维方式
An Example of the Panning-for-Gold Approach
